posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Cool looking build! On my server there is a weapon called double scimitar, which has the same weapon focus as the regular scimitar but needs all the feats for duel wielding as well as Weapon Pro. Exotic. If I switch out the feats Imp KD, Disarm, Imp. Disarm and toughness for the others, will it ruin the build? On my server disarm has been nerfed to the point where no one uses it. I was just thinking it would be nice to duel wield than switch to a sword and board if needed. TY for your time.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Unless your server has a custom 4th dual-wielding feat, you would only have to drop 3 feats to dual-wield. The problem is that Ambidexterity requires 15 DEX, and taking 7 points from elsewhere to boost DEX to 15 would really hurt this build.
That said, it can be done. I think that the feats to drop would be the 2 Disarm feats and Great Fortitude (which would leave you with a still-impressive 39 Fortitude). Dropping starting STR from 19 to 17 would give you 5 points, bringing DEX to 14. The other 2 points should probably come from INT, but that will cost you 43 skill points. You would have to drop Disable Trap, Set Trap, and Search, and lower your UMD by 10, and spend 2 points to raise your Spellcreaft by 1 to compensate for the lost INT. That would leave you with 3 skill points to spend somewhere.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: damn...I see. I meant 3 for duel and one so I can take the Weapon Pro:Exotic, so 4 total. Yeah...no sure about the whole duel wielding thing now...lol. Ty for your time Empyre.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Campgod, If you want to turn this build into a dual-wielder i suggest you go with Human. Then you should change your starting/ ending stats to: ((Str 17 (34) - Dex 15 - Con 12 - Int 13 - Wis 8 - Cha 8)) and use your Human bonus feat along with (Disarm, Improved Disarm and Lightning Reflexes) in order to gain  your necessary 4 feats for your ccharacter. Your new (15) Dexterity will overcompensate for the loss of "Lightning Reflexes" and from there everything is the same more or less. You will have of course to take Devastating Critical on a letter level since you won't have exactly the same monstrous Strength as before and that will also have a slight impact on your AB and Dev. Crit. DC as well (-1 to both) but you will gain two additional attacks and it will be more fun to play (i advice dual kukris for that).

Good luck!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi there! Digging this one up from the past. Just come back from my coach trip into Dragon Age, and want to hit things a lot and hard, with a total absence of nuance. Plus, I've never played a Half-Orc to conclusion. Thus...

It's a shame, but I'm biting the bullet on the 20% xp penalty Hip mentions above, as I plan to either be in MTS or SoF by the time it really kicks in, so should still get level 40 with plenty of time to enjoy it.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Quoted from this: http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Disarm
  • Not all creatures can be disarmed. Natural weapons cannot be disarmed, nor can cursed weapons. In addition, a creature cannot be disarmed while polymorphed, and many non-player characters are flagged as not disarmable (possibly for balance or module-economy, possibly because that is the default setting in the Toolset).
  • If a non-player character is wielding a non-droppable weapon when successfully disarmed, the weapon is destroyed instead of being placed on the ground.
This is why I have never bothered with Disarm.

Life can get very confusing even when you're looking for a relatively unsubtle build! No offence intended, Valeror!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
1st) Both MTS & SoF give so much Exp that 20% penalty doesn't mean much. If that is a concern then you could follow my suggestion and simply change the race to human and put your attributes in such a way as to have 14 charisma. That is going to give you a tremendous short duration buff for the hardest fights (exactly when you need it).

2nd) Disarm & Improved Disarm are very useful in PW's, not so much perhaps in modules but in WoG, for example, they have proven their worth over and over again. When an opponent has a buffed magic weapon of note and suddenly loses it, then his whole attack schedule is ruined, making him practically a non-threat. Now here is another tip, having a two-handed weapon makes Improved Disarm so much better because you take a (+4) bonus in your attempts versus medium weapons, more if those are small (kukris for example). In those situations, Improved Disarm can even be an AB booster for you!

3rd) Are you going to play this from level one, starting from the OC/Aielund? If that is the case then I would not recommend this for you Stag. Losing 1AB to gain early availability to rogue goodies would be more important for you, but if you are starting this from say, level fifteen or more it is perfectly fine.
